description: The Mahila Samriddhi Yojana, implemented by the National Backward Classes Finance and Development Corporation, provides micro-finance to women entrepreneurs from backward communities through SHGs, promoting economic empowerment and self-reliance.

benefits.loan_amount: Up to Rs. 1.5 Lakhs per SHG member
benefits.interest_rate: Subsidized interest rate, max 4% per annum

community_criteria: Must belong to Other Backward Classes (OBC) or other notified backward communities

steps: Form or join an SHG through the National Backward Classes Finance and Development Corporation
Submit an application through the SHG with a business plan
Attach required documents, including OBC certificate and SHG registration
Applications are reviewed by the corporation

special_notes: Loans are provided through SHGs, not individuals
SHGs must undergo financial literacy training
Priority is given to viable business plans
